summary.content: Will show you information about the certificate, certificate chain, time-to-expiration, etc. Hostname (without https:// at the beginning) The hostname whose TLS certificate you’d like to scan. Port The response is returned in JSON format. If the number of days until expiration is closer than the days query string parameter, then it will respond with an HTTP 400 status code. Otherwise, it will return with a HTTP 200 status code. This makes the response suitable for adding to your uptime ping checks with a 24-hour frequency.

content.html:
Will show you information about the certificate, certificate chain, time-to-expiration, etc.

The hostname whose TLS certificate you’d like to scan.

The response is returned in JSON format.

If the number of days until expiration is closer than the days query string parameter, then it will respond with an HTTP 400 status code. Otherwise, it will return with a HTTP 200 status code.

This makes the response suitable for adding to your uptime ping checks with a 24-hour frequency. If the alert goes off, you have the given number of days to rotate your TLS certificates for your hostname.

content.source:
{{}} Will show you information about the certificate, certificate chain, time-to-expiration, etc. {{}}
The hostname whose TLS certificate you’d like to scan.

The response is returned in JSON format.

If the number of days until expiration is closer than the days query string parameter, then it will respond with an HTTP 400 status code. Otherwise, it will return with a HTTP 200 status code.

This makes the response suitable for adding to your uptime ping checks with a 24-hour frequency. If the alert goes off, you have the given number of days to rotate your TLS certificates for your hostname.
